meanings.definition: Thin sheet metal coated with a thin layer of tin.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman used tinplate to create shiny containers.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen shelves were filled with tinplate cans.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with a piece of tinplate, making a lot of noise.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight reflected off the tinplate roof, creating a magical glow.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the tinplate toy train, admiring its gleaming surface.

meanings.definition: To coat with a thin layer of tin.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers tinplate the steel sheets for rust protection.
meanings.sent2: She carefully tinplates the jewelry to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally tinplated the wrong side of the cake pan, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to tinplate her heart, leaving it protected but cold.
meanings.sent5: The artist tinplated the sculpture, transforming it into a work of art with a metallic sheen.
